chapter.title: Elements of self-awareness
chapter.content:
Elements of self-awareness

A foundational step to self-determination is gaining self-awareness, which may be defined by these elements:

  • Understanding your needs, preferences, strengths, and weaknesses
  • Becoming aware of your options
  • Acknowledging what is important to you

chapter.title: Self-awareness questions
chapter.content:
Self-awareness questions

A self-determined person can answer these questions:

  • What are my areas of strength and what is difficult for me?
  • What do I enjoy and what is important to me?
  • How well do I understand my learning disability and how can I explain my disability to others?

Consider your own experiences, and the information we’ve discussed so far in this course. Which of these questions might be particularly difficult for individuals with LD to answer? Why might they be difficult?

After you have thought about your answer, click the forward arrow.

chapter.title: Challenges to developing self-awareness
chapter.content:
Challenges to developing self-awareness

Some possible challenges individuals with LD may face in developing self-awareness are:

  • being unaware that they have a learning disability due to a lack of diagnosis;
  • having a diagnosis, but lacking an understanding of their LD; and
  • experiencing failure at school or work, but not being able to identify likely causes or areas of strength.

chapter.title: Activity: Identify ways you can help individuals with LD build self-awareness
chapter.content:
Activity: Identify ways you can help individuals with LD build self-awareness

Based on this information, and your own experiences, consider what you can do as a service provider to help individuals with LD increase their self-awareness.

Please write down for yourself at least one thing you can do to support individuals with LD to build their self-awareness. You will refer back to your ideas later in this course.

When you finished recording your ideas, click the forward arrow to proceed.

chapter.title: Ideas for building self-awareness
chapter.content:
Ideas for building self-awareness

Some ideas for building self-awareness in individuals with LD include:

  • encourage individuals to self-assess their strengths and needs;
  • provide specific feedback on areas of strength and need you have observed;
  • ask individuals what they liked and disliked about a task or activity; and
  • ask individuals what was easier and more difficult about a task.

Take a moment to compare your ideas with those listed.

When you are ready to move on, continue on to Valuing Oneself
